Cetearyl Alcohol = Cetyl Stearic Alcohol = Cetostearyl Alcohol
(These are all names for the mixture of cetyl and stearyl alcohols)
Don't confuse with cetyl NF

CTG and CCT are actually the same thing - they are both abbreviations for Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride. However, using both CTG and CCT together (like "CTG (CCT)") is redundant since they refer to the same ingredient.

They are different from chamomile extract.
